articles.title: Advanced Root Canal Techniques: A Clinical Approach
articles.excerpt: Exploring modern endodontic approaches for complex root canal cases with detailed step-by-step methodology and clinical outcomes.
articles.content:
Introduction

Endodontic treatment has evolved significantly with advances in technology and techniques. This comprehensive guide explores evidence-based approaches to complex root canal cases, providing clinicians with practical protocols for achieving predictable outcomes.

Clinical Examination and Diagnosis

Proper diagnosis forms the foundation of successful endodontic treatment. A systematic approach to clinical examination includes:

  • Comprehensive medical and dental history
  • Visual and tactile examination
  • Percussion and palpation tests
  • Thermal and electric pulp testing
  • Radiographic examination including CBCT when indicated

Advanced Instrumentation Techniques

Modern rotary and reciprocating systems have revolutionized root canal preparation. Key considerations include:

  • Proper access cavity design
  • Glide path establishment
  • Apical patency maintenance
  • Irrigation protocol optimization

articles.title: Managing Broken Files: Clinical Protocol and Prevention
articles.excerpt: Comprehensive guide to preventing and managing broken endodontic files with evidence-based protocols and case studies.
articles.content:
Understanding File Separation

File separation remains one of the most challenging complications in endodontic therapy. This article provides a systematic approach to prevention and management.

Prevention Strategies

  • Proper pre-operative assessment
  • Creating straight-line access
  • Using files according to manufacturer guidelines
  • Regular file inspection
  • Proper irrigation and lubrication
